example_usage: Hemolysis is red blood cell breakdown.
Leukopenia is low white blood cells.
Agoraphobia is fear of open spaces.
Anemia is without enough red blood cells.
Infraorbital is below the eye socket.
Hemiplegia is paralysis of one side.

definition: Toward the head or upper part of body.
example_usage: The nose is superior to the mouth.

definition: Toward the feet or lower part of body.
example_usage: The stomach is inferior to the heart.

definition: Toward the front of the body.
example_usage: The sternum is anterior to the heart.

definition: Toward the back of the body.
example_usage: The spine is posterior to the heart.

definition: Toward the midline of the body.
example_usage: The nose is medial to the eyes.

definition: Away from the midline of the body.
example_usage: The ears are lateral to the nose.

definition: Closer to the trunk or point of attachment.
example_usage: The elbow is proximal to the wrist.

definition: Farther from the trunk or point of attachment.
example_usage: The fingers are distal to the elbow.

definition: Closer to the surface of the body.
Farther from the surface of the body.

example_usage: Patient positioned prone for back surgery.

definition: Lying face up on the back.
Lying with head lower than feet.
Lying on back with legs raised in stirrups.
An imaginary line dividing body into left and right.
example_usage: Midsagittal plane divides body in half.

definition: An imaginary line dividing body into front and back.
example_usage: Coronal plane separates anterior from posterior.

definition: An imaginary line dividing body into upper and lower.
example_usage: Transverse plane separates superior from inferior.

definition: When a patient enters the hospital to stay overnight or longer.
When a patient leaves the hospital to go home.
Moving a patient from one unit or facility to another.
Asking another doctor or specialist for their opinion.
Sending a patient to see another doctor or specialist.
example_usage: Referral to orthopedics for knee pain.

definition: A return appointment to check on progress.
A scheduled time to see a healthcare provider.
Seeing a provider without an appointment.
When a patient misses an appointment without canceling.
When a patient cancels an appointment.
Changing an appointment to a different time.
The process of arriving and registering for an appointment.
example_usage: Patient checked in at front desk.

definition: The process of leaving after an appointment.
example_usage: Patient checked out and scheduled follow-up.

definition: Collecting patient information and insurance details.
Determining how urgent a patient's condition is.
example_usage: ER nurse triaged patient as urgent.

definition: The initial process of gathering patient information.
example_usage: Intake includes medical history and vitals.

definition: Bringing a patient from waiting room to exam room.
Area where patients wait before seeing provider.
example_usage: Patient in waiting room for 15 minutes.

definition: Private room where provider sees patient.

example_usage: Patient in observation for chest pain.

definition: A patient admitted to stay in the hospital.
A patient receiving care without staying overnight.
The hospital department treating urgent medical problems.
example_usage: Patient presented to ER with chest pain.

definition: A clinic for non-life-threatening problems that need quick attention.
example_usage: Went to urgent care for sprained ankle.

definition: Hospital unit for critically ill patients.
Hospital unit for patients who need less care than ICU but more than regular floor.
example_usage: Patient moved to step-down from ICU.

definition: Hospital unit with continuous heart monitoring.
General hospital floor for medical and surgical patients.

example_usage: Patient taken to OR for appendectomy.
Patient in PACU recovering from anesthesia.

definition: When doctors visit hospitalized patients to check progress.
Transferring patient care information between providers.
example_usage: Nurse gave handoff at shift change.

definition: Emergency code for cardiac or respiratory arrest.
Emergency team for patients getting worse but not yet in arrest.
example_usage: Rapid response called for low blood pressure.

definition: An order not to perform CPR if heart stops.
An order not to put in a breathing tube.
Legal document stating wishes for medical care if unable to communicate.
example_usage: Patient has advanced directive on file.

definition: Person authorized to make medical decisions for someone else.
Agreement to treatment after understanding risks and benefits.
When a patient leaves hospital against doctor's recommendation.
When a patient leaves the hospital without permission.
A list of tasks or patients to be seen.
A group of patients assigned to staff.
Electronic messages and tasks for a provider.
Lab or imaging findings sent to provider.
Online system where patients access their medical information.
Electronic message from patient through patient portal.
example_usage: Patient sent portal message about symptoms.

definition: Encrypted electronic communication between patient and provider.
Healthcare provided through video or phone.
When computer systems are not working.

example_usage: Lab interface sends results to EHR.

definition: Making different computer systems work together.
Ability of different systems to exchange information.
Digital version of patient medical records.
Digital medical record within one organization.
Addition to a medical record after it's completed.
Confirming accuracy and signing a document.
A supervising provider signing a trainee's note.
Take medication only when needed, not on a schedule.
A written order for medication from a doctor.
Medication that can be bought without a prescription.
Getting more of the same medication.
Pharmacy must give brand name not generic.
Non-brand name version of a drug.
Original drug made by company that discovered it.
List of medications covered by insurance.
example_usage: Check if drug is on formulary.

definition: Insurance approval needed before getting certain medications.
Insurance requires trying cheaper drugs first.
example_usage: Must fail step therapy before approval.

definition: Insurance limits how much medication can be filled.
example_usage: Quantity limit of 30 tablets per month.

definition: Reviewing and updating complete medication list.
